gov.usgs.anss.inventory

Class Response

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.inventory.Response

  • public class Response
extends java.lang.Object
    Response.java If the name of the class does not match the name of the field in the class you may need to modify the rs.getSTring in the constructor. This Response templace for creating a MySQL database object. It is not really needed by the ResponsePanel which uses the DBObject system for changing a record in the database file. However, you have to have this shell to create objects containing a MySQL record for passing around and manipulating. There are two constructors normally given:
    1) passed a result set positioned to the MySQL record to decode
    2) Passed all of the data arguments needed to build the same set of data.
    The Response should be replaced with capitalized version (class name) for the file. response should be replaced with the lower case version (for variables). Both the constructors use the "makeResponse(list of data args) to set the local variables to the value. The result set just uses the rs.get???("fieldname") to get the data from the database where the other passes the arguments from the caller.
    Notes on Enums :
    * data class should have code like :
    import java.util.ArrayList; /// Import for Enum manipulation
    .
    static ArrayList fieldEnum; // This list will have Strings corresponding to enum
    .
    .
    // To convert an enum we need to create the fieldEnum ArrayList. Do only once(static)
    if(fieldEnum == null) fieldEnum = FUtil.getEnum(UC.getConnection(),"table","fieldName");

    // Get the int corresponding to an Enum String for storage in the data base and
    // the index into the JComboBox representing this Enum
    localVariable = FUtil.enumStringToInt(fieldEnum, enumString);
    Created on July 8, 2002, 1:23 PM

      • Response

        public Response(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create a instance of this table row from a positioned result set
        Parameters:
        rs - The ResultSet already SELECTED
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQLException If the ResultSet is Improper, network is down, or database is down

      • Response

        public Response(int inID,
                int eqID,
                int itID,
                java.sql.Timestamp eff,
                int out,
                int in,
                java.lang.String inPort,
                double gn,
                int snID,
                double dip,
                double az)
        create a row record from individual variables
        Parameters:
        inID - The ID in the database, normally zero for this type of construction
        eqID - Equipment Type ID(if zero, this is for a piece of equipment)
        itID - Item ID (if zero, this is for a equipment type only)
        eff - The effective date of this change
        out - The output channel from this piece of equipment
        in - The input channel number within the input port
        inPort - The String corresponding to a port in the equipment type
        gn - The gain, by SEED convention this positive unless stage inverts
        snID - The snipID for the Shape snip for this stage
        dip - The change in dip resulting from this stage (normally zero)
        az - The change in azimuth due to this stage

      • getDipAddition

        public double getDipAddition()
        return the dip angle to add to previous dip action based on this stage. normally zero since orientation is not change. But, if channels were reversed in a change SEED says reorient the channel but leave its channel alone.
        Returns:

      • getAzimuthAddition

        public double getAzimuthAddition()
        return the azimuth to add to previous stage due to this stage. Normally 0 but this does allow a stage to "swap around" channels
        Returns:
        .
